required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Short-term Oxygen During CPET in ILD
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Short-term Ambulatory Oxygen Therapy on Cardiopulmonary Exercise Capacity in Patients With Interstitial Lung Disease (ILD)

brief_summary.textblock: In a randomized, sham-controlled crossover trial the investigators will test whether supplemental oxygen given during cardiopulmonary exercise testing will improve exercise performance and physiological parameters in patients with interstitial lung disease.

primary_outcome.description: Maximal Work Rate (Watt max) measured during incremental exercise tests (IET) in cardiopulmonary exercise tests
Endurance (sec) with 75% Wmax measured during constant work rate exercise tests (CWRET) in cardiopulmonary exercise tests

secondary_outcome.measure: changes in physiological vital signs: Heart rate (hr)
changes in physiological vital signs: Blood pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic and diastolic blood pressure (in mmHg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in breathing patterns: Minute ventilation (VE)
Changes in breathing patterns: Oxygen uptake (VO2)
Changes in breathing patterns: Carbon dioxide output (VCO2)
Changes in breathing patterns: Breathing equivalent for O2 (VE/VO2)
secondary_outcome.description: ratio between minute ventilation and oxygen uptake

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in breathing patterns: Breathing equivalent for O2 (VE/VCO2)
secondary_outcome.description: ratio between minute ventilation and carbon dioxide output
Ratio between minute ventilation and carbon dioxide output if carbon dioxide reaches the breathing plateau

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in breathing patterns: Ventilatory threshold one (Vt1)
secondary_outcome.description: represents the start of anaerobic metabolism

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in breathing patterns: Ventilatory threshold two (Vt2)
secondary_outcome.description: represents the start of higher percentage of the anaerobic metabolism

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in arterial blood: arterial partial pressure of O2 (PaO2)
Changes in arterial blood: arterial partial pressure of CO2 (PaCO2)
Changes in arterial blood: arterial lactate concentration
Changes in arterial blood: pondus Hydrogenii (pH) values
Changes in tissue oxygenation: Pulse oxymetrie (SpO2, measured at the finger)
Changes in tissue oxygenation: Cerebral tissue oxygenation (CTO, measured at the forehead)
Changes in tissue oxygenation: Muscle tissue oxygenation (MTO, measured at the quadriceps muscle)

arm_group.description: Supplemental oxygen will be applied via a mask during CPET
Sham ambient air will be applied via mask during CPET

intervention.description: Incremental cardio pulmonary exercise test until exhaustion
constant (on 75% Wmax) cardio pulmonary exercise test until exhaustion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- interstitial lung disease, diagnosed by high-resolution CT
- FEV1/FVC >70% and FVC <85% predicted
- stable medication for at least 4 weeks
- Desaturation in SpO2 in 6-minute walk test of ≥ 4% to absolute values ≤ 92%
- Signed Informed Consent
- Male and female patients 18 to 80 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe daytime hypoxemia (PaO2 ≤7.3 or <55 mmHg at rest)
- Other clinically significant concomitant disease states (e.g., cardiovascular disease, hepatic dysfunction, etc)
- Inability to follow the procedures of the study, e.g. due to language problems, psychological disorders, dementia or confusional state of the subject, neurological or orthopaedic problems with walking disability or inability to ride a bicycle
- Women who are pregnant or breast feeding

facility.name: Respiratory Clinic, University Hospital of Zurich
